Warm-up (2-3 min)

Descriptive review:

lo blanu tsani = ?
lo snime cu cpana lo tumla = ?

(Answers: the blue sky, snow is on the ground)

New Material (5-7 min)

Journal Entry Structure

A good journal entry includes:

  • Events — What happened (with tenses)
  • Feelings — How you felt (attitudinals)
  • Thoughts — What you thought (abstractions)

Sample Journal Entry

ca lo ca djedi mi cikna ca lo cerni
.i ba bo mi citka lo nanba .e lo ckafi
.i .ui lo solri cu carmi
.i ba bo mi klama lo briju
.i mi puca'o gunka ze'u
.i .oi mi tatpi
.i ku'i mi pumo'u snada lo nu ciska lo lisri
.i mi gleki tu'a ri
.i ba lo nu gunka kei mi xruti lo zdani
.i ca mi surla gi'e tcidu lo cukta
.i pe'i lo ca djedi cu xamgu

Today I woke up in the morning. Then I ate bread and coffee. Yay, the sun was shining! Then I went to work. I was working for a long time. Ow, I was tired. But I completed writing a story. I'm happy about it. After work, I returned home. Now I rest and read a book. In my opinion, today was good.

Key Elements

Element Example
Tense ca lo ca djedi, puca'o
Sequence .i ba bo
Feeling .ui, .oi, mi gleki
Opinion pe'i, mi jinvi

Key Point

Include events, feelings, and thoughts for a complete journal entry.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise: Write Your Journal Entry

Write a 10+ sentence journal entry about:

  • Your day (real or imagined)
  • Include at least 2 attitudinals
  • Include at least 1 opinion
Example Structure
  1. Wake up
  2. Morning activities
  3. Feeling about morning
  4. Main activity
  5. Details about it
  6. How you felt
  7. Another event
  8. Evening activities
  9. Current state
  10. Opinion about the day
Example Answer 
mi pu cikna ca lo cerni
.i ba bo mi lumci mi gi'e taxfu
.i ba bo mi citka lo cerni cidja
.i .ui lo solri cu carmi
.i ba bo mi klama lo ckule
.i mi puca'o cilre la .jbobau. ze'a
.i ri nandu ku'i cinri
.i ba lo nu cilre kei mi xruti lo zdani
.i ca mi surla gi'e ciska lo pemci
.i pe'i lo ca djedi cu xamgu
.i mi pacna lo nu lo bavla djedi cu simsa

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Read your journal entry aloud.

Focus on:

  • Natural flow
  • Pronunciation
  • Expression of feelings

Today's Practice

Journal checklist:

  • 10+ sentences
  • Events with sequence
  • Feelings (attitudinals)
  • Thoughts/opinions
  • Varied tenses

Summary

You wrote a complete journal entry with events, feelings, and thoughts in Lojban.
